node.title: Margaret fled her home 20 years ago. Violence in Solomon Islands has brought back painful memories
node.alt: An Australian soldier questions a local in Honiara
node.description: Margaret Teobasi Tadokata says the deadly riots and unrest in the Solomon Islands capital Honiara echo the ethnic tensions that forced her and her young family to flee the country more than two decades ago.
node.content:
["Margaret Teobasi Tadokata says the deadly riots and unrest in the Solomon Islands capital Honiara echo the ethnic tensions that forced her and her young family to flee the country more than two decades ago.", "Ms Teobasi Tadokata\u00a0arrived in Australia in 2000 with her husband and her then two-month-old\u00a0baby.", "Ethic tensions began as fighting between people from the island of Guadacanal,\u00a0which is home to the capital Honiara, and settlers from the most populous island of Malaita Province.", "", "
Ms\u00a0Teobasi Tadokata and her young family were forced to flee Solomon Islands.(Supplied)
", "From 1998 to 2003 internal ethnic conflict between militants in Malaita and nearby\u00a0Guadalcanal became known as 'the tensions'.", "It is estimated at least 200 people died.", "\"We couldn't go to Guadacanal. It's unsafe for me. And we couldn't go to Malaita, it's unsafe for my husband.", "", "
Renewed unrest has pitched\u00a0people from Malaita against\u00a0Guadalcanal residents.(ABC News: Evan Wasuka)
", "\"It was so unsafe, it was so scary.", "\"So that's why we fled\u00a0the country and we came over to Australia.\"", "Ms Teobasi Tadokata recalls militia\u00a0coming to her house, trying to harm her husband.", "\"They were actually trying to hurt him and we went into hiding for a few days until we got a visa and we could get out of the country,\" she says.", "Ms\u00a0Teobasi Tadokata\u00a0watched on through the news and social media as riots broke out\u00a0in Honiara last Wednesday, with protesters mostly of Malaita origin calling for Prime Minister Manasseh Sogavare to resign.", "At least three people have died\u00a0\u2014 found in a burnt-out building in Honiara's Chinatown\u00a0\u2014 and more than 100 have been arrested for alleged looting and arson.", "\"It just breaks your heart, like seeing everything now people are posting,\" she says.", "\"It's really, really emotional at the moment.", "\"Your heart aches and\u00a0really, you feel very helpless.\"", "", "
Looting has taken place in Honiara's Chinatown.(Reuters:\u00a0Jone Tuiipelehaki)
", "While far from home, she is in touch with friends and family members based on Honiara who have fallen victim to recent rioting.", "\"One of my uncles\u00a0... his whole shop has been burned down,\" she says.", "\"Now I know that all my aunties and cousins and uncles, that's their income, that's the family money that comes in.", "\"So it's gone like that. What's next? It's really, really worrying and stressful.\"", "
Chinese residents have experienced targeted violence before
", "For\u00a0Phillip Leong, who is also based in Melbourne, watching the unrest in his home country is distressing \u2014 but nothing he hasn't experienced before.", "The Brisbane born\u00a041-year-old\u00a0grew up in Solomon Islands but left in\u00a02001, towards the end of the ethnic tensions.", "", "
Mr Leong's mother is still in Solomon Islands.(Supplied: Phillip Leong)
", "\"They are pretty much ... happy people, but when it comes to political issues\u00a0there are different views and ideas,\" Mr Leong says.", "\"What I experienced is ... if there's disagreement, there's always got to be ...\u00a0rioting and looting, and\u00a0that's pretty sad.", "\"It was sad for me to experience that when I was there back in in the late 90s.\"", "", "
Violence in Honiara has sent shockwaves\u00a0through the Solomon Islands diaspora.(ABC News: Evan Wasuka)
", "Mr Leong is of ethnic Chinese background and is also the president of the Solomon Islands Victoria Association.", "His grandfather was Chinese and helped build Honiara's Chinatown.", "Seeing Chinese-owned businesses targeted in recent riots has been difficult to watch.", "\"It's so sad because a lot of the Solomon Islands communities here, we all have families and friends back home,\" he says.", "\"A lot of us do have connections with\u00a0the people back home,\u00a0they have the businesses ... being looted, burned to the ground.\"", "Mr Leong remains\u00a0in touch with his family in Honiara and said\u00a0it was painful to be so far away from his mother."]
